results.title: Hear no evil
results.creator_credit: Fiona Hergstrom, December Films and Kate Hampel
results.brief_description: Helena, manager of flamboyant suburban heavy metal “vampire” band Catwitch, has great expectations for their success. Her aspirations are hampered by the reality of organising a group of suburban boys. Through insight into family relationships and the everyday lives of band members and fans, we see how excessive music has a direct relationship to the suburban culture from which they come. A heady mix between heightened fantasy and suburban reality.

results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. results.title: Hear better: healthy ears
results.brief_description: Opens with a summary of the pleasures that result from hearing well. The structure of the ear is shown in detail and the process of receiving air vibrations and transmitting them into sounds is explained. Concludes with general information on how to take care of the ears.
results.description: Opens with a summary of the pleasures that result from hearing well. The structure of the ear is shown in detail and the process of receiving air vibrations and transmitting them into sounds is explained. Concludes with general information on how to take care of the ears.

results.title: Healthy mother, healthy baby
results.brief_description: In this program the importance of proper nutrition and good eating habits during pregnancy are stressed. Also, the need for expectant mothers to make sound decisions regarding the use of alcohol, cigarettes, caffeine, and drugs, are explained. This film offers a valuable guide to pregnant women and teenagers.

results.title: Healthy lungs
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows the part of the breathing mechanism in contact with the air and demonstrates how the exchange of waste products for oxygen takes place. Explains how disease affects the lungs and recommends procedures to keep the lungs in a healthy condition.

results.title: Health: the inside story
results.brief_description: A common-sense approach to attaining and maintaining good health. Shows the role of muscular endurance, heart and lung endurance and nutrition in a healthy lifestyle. Indicates health hazards such as smoking and stress, and emphasises the need for relaxation. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Health: communicable diseases. - 2nd edition.
results.creator_credit: Michael Wright, AIMS Instructional Media and David Winter
results.brief_description: Using an animated clay germ to answer the question of how people get sick. The germ tells where germs live and how they are spread from person to person, and then shows how they can be prevented from spreading. Also presents cautionary measures to be taken when sick, along with cautions about taking medicine without grown-up supervision.

results.title: Health, stress and coping
results.creator_credit: Carol Trussell, Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
In our everyday life, we experience wear and tear, that is, stress. A stressor is anything that requires the body to respond to life by setting off a series of chemical and physical reactions. Individuals respond to, and cope with, stress in different ways, but increasingly scientists are acknowledging the relationship between high levels of stress and the human immune system. This program examines how and why excessive stress affects us.

results.title: Health, mind and behavior
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this program, Philip Zimbardo investigates the power the mind has on the functioning of our bodies, in particular, the effect of stress on our health. Increasingly, scientists have had to acknowledge this connection in treating human illness. Zimbardo reveals how a holistic approach to healing, which aims to keep mind and body in harmony, can reduce the impact of stress- related illness such as hypertension and improve the functioning of the human immune system.
